title: Average Reward Reinforcement Learning for Omega-Regular and Mean-Payoff Objectives
summary: Recent advances in reinforcement learning (RL) have renewed focus on the design of reward functions that shape agent behavior. Manually designing reward functions is tedious and error-prone. A principled alternative is to specify behaviors in a formal language that can be automatically translated into rewards.
